intro: Litobrochia lonchophora, commonly known as the rock bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and distinctive blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It features opposite, ovate leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
